website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills, high-quality, low-cost 1-liter cordless kettle.
pros: Simple design and limited technology features make it easy to use

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! This pot just did a meltdown. Fire department had to be called to get the smoke out of the house. Fire department agreed the pot malfunction. Purchased February 2019. Burned up May 2019!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not stainless seam around base
customer_reviews.text: used to be my favorite thing. now the ring around the central stainless base (if you look closely you see it's not one piece) has rust spots on it. The opening with the lid makes it incredibly difficult to fit your hand in with some steel wool to scrub the stains off. i already tried for about 2 mins. i dont know if i have the patience. it's really uncomfortable and awkward to stick your hand inside to scrub properly. "stainless" ... smh. i add photo later since many people show shiny photo.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Great for the office; starting to become unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a great deal and I like the small size, which is good for a quick cup of tea or pourover at the office. After four months of regular use (about 2-3 times a day) it is starting to become unreliable. Getting it to turn on requires removing and re-seating the kettle a few times, and it sometimes turns off before the full cycle is finished.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Metallic Taste!
customer_reviews.text: Water boiled in this definitely has a metallic taste. I'm returning it and ordering a better quality glass kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Judicious

customer_reviews.title: Great Value with a few limitations
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is great overall. We had a KitchenAid Pro Kettle die on us and we wanted something cheaper to replace it. For the price, this kettle is an excellent value. It takes approximately 4-5 minutes to boil a full kettle of water from room temperature. Pros: Quick boiling (4-5) minutes Great value Easy to use Sturdy design Easy to Clean Cons: The body is not insulated so it gets very hot. Make sure to only grab the kettle by the handle. The lid does not open all the way when pressing the release button. I have to push the lid open further to be able to fill it under a faucet. No temperature adjustment
customer_reviews.author: mchannah

customer_reviews.title: Failed after the 5th. use. But did not ...
customer_reviews.text: Failed after the 5th. use. But did not pop up,result was all the water boiling out and the steam staining our cherry cabinets. Stay faar away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Saltman

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I received the product as scheduled. After using it once, it stopped working. I had to return it. What a waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: beautiful cloud

customer_reviews.title: This kettle seems sturdy and boiled the full capacity of 1 liter of ...
customer_reviews.text: This kettle seems sturdy and boiled the full capacity of 1 liter of water for me in 5 minutes (to a roaring boil). Thought it would be faster but was satisfied with the speed compared to two other products the "Hamilton Beach 1.7L Stainless Steel Electric Kettle 40894" which boiled the same 1 liter literally 3 seconds faster but interesting this is that the Hamilton didn't come to a roaring boil just got hot enough and turned off as most all electric kettles do.Second, i compared to is "Ovente KG83 Series 1.5L Glass Electric Kettle, Black" which took me 10 full minutes to boil 1.5 liters of water which is ridiculous so I didn't even try with just 1 liter.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Yang

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously hot to touch!
customer_reviews.text: Gets burning hot on the outside - I’ve had plenty of electric kettles and none had this issue. I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Ess Bee

customer_reviews.title: Good for price and fast.
customer_reviews.text: Just received today (Thursday, 9/28/17) after ordering on September 25🙂. Cycled water through x 2 as per instruction after set up with no problems. A liter of water boiled fast in less than 3 minutes🙂. Only complaint and the reason why I rated 4 stars is that the kettle gets extremely hot 🔥. It would have been much better if it was double walled stainless steel construction. Thinking about sending it right back and getting a more expensive double walled kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Monica D

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Broke in a week. Seems that the electrical wiring burned itself out
customer_reviews.author: RDA

customer_reviews.title: A really easy to use kettle that boils quickly and shuts itself ...
customer_reviews.text: A really easy to use kettle that boils quickly and shuts itself off when the water boils. It has saved me the problem of worrying about whether I remembered to turn the stove off in the mornings when I leave for work. My only caveat would be that it's tempting to fill this to the top even though the "1.0 L" mark is about 3 inches from the lid - and if you do fill it to the top, you will inevitably spill as (1) the water will boil out of the spout, and (2) it's impossible to pour from the spout without some leakage when it's too full.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: At its worst quality
customer_reviews.text: Leaks from the first usage, returned this in 10 mts of arrival
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Nice though smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: It's smaller than I expected. My fault as I should have realized this based on the clearly stated 1 liter capacity. Pictured next to our old Breville SK500XL which I'd repaired (new contacts in base etc) several times before it finally died. The smaller size of the Amazon probably saves money, no more boiling too much water and it takes up less space on kitchen counter. I've didn't experience any odors on first use, I'll update review if we get corrosion.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Totally solid kettle for the price, but for regular use, I'd spring for a nicer Bodum one
customer_reviews.text: Totally solid kettle for the price. I got it to use temporarily on a very long work trip and it was fine, but for home use, I prefer my more expensive, but more practical Bodum kettle. The key differences: - The AmazonBasics kettle's minimum fill line is too much water for one cup - As a result of requiring more water, it boils slower - Overall capacity is small - Power cord is short - Kettle is noisy when heating, but the click when it's ready is too quiet That said, using this kettle is much faster than a stovetop kettle and better than a microwave by far.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Un-hinged.
customer_reviews.text: Kettle was a nice introduction to this type of appliance--I was enjoying it--but after only eight uses--and I treated this item with a great deal of care (!)--the top door hinge, for no obvious reason, became "unhinged." (A piece of plastic broke off and fell into the water, causing the small bent-paper-clip-type hinge to pop out.) So I had to order another kettle (a different manufacturer--at least, ostensibly--though) this morning to replace this one. This kettle isn't expensive, so it's clearly not a huge financial burden to replace it, but what is the cost of landfills being filled with more and more planned obsolescence appliances?

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic kettle! I didn’t have high hopes for this kettle, but it was only $16, so I thought I’d give it a try. Yes, as others have noted, it is quite loud. However, it heats up extremely quickly! It is 1500 Watts, compared to most others that are 1000 to 1200 Watts. In fact, it took 4 minutes, on the dot, to boil 1000ml. The other issue I have is that the button to start is a little funky. Oddly, the kettle has to be in a certain position on the base for the lever to stay down. All that to say, though, I would recommend this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Spindler

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase !
customer_reviews.text: This works really well. I use it everytime I make coffee. The water boils pretty fast. And the kettle turns itself off once the water boils, safety feature's pretty functional.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and the base didn’t sit flush the the teapot. It wobbles and doesn’t feel very stable. I was hoping once I turned the kettle on there would be a locking mechanism but no such luck. Bummed this wasn’t better quality
customer_reviews.author: Barry S. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great price & product!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised with how well this works! I was nervous about buying an electric kettle for such a low price when other products seemed to be in a higher price range. I tried this just because it was Amazons choice and it didn’t dissapoint. It’s quick & quiet although pretty basic with only one button. Once it’s done, it auto shuts off so that the water stops boiling. I would highly recommend this product for anyone looking for an electric kettle!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and weird taste
customer_reviews.text: Strong and unbearable metallic taste which my other steel kettle don’t have. I already threw the package box so I couldn’t return it anymore. Hopefully the taste will fade away eventually, which hasn’t happen after a month anyway. But I strongly suggest people don’t buy this item or at least keep you package box just to in case.
customer_reviews.author: firmianarain

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Amazing Kettle!!
customer_reviews.text: Great kettle and oh so cheap!!! This kettle is easy to use, very cheap, and very good. I have been using it for about 2 months and it still works like the first time. Has clear indicators for the amount of water you are filling. Gets boiling hot in about 1 minute. The automatic off switch is perfect for mornings so you can do other things while the water boils. Make sure you empty all the remaining water out of the kettle and leave the lid open to let all the steam exit to avoid corrosion or anything. Love this little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Darin French

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Beats stovetop heat.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Do not wash with soap and water after opening. I almost did but stopped with the water running because I didn’t think I should get the electronic base wet. Thank goodness I stopped to read the instructions. All you need to do is boil water in the kettle twice, replacing the water the second time. Then it’s clean! The water heats up super fast. Easy to use. The base doesn’t get the counter hot. Really beats boiling the water in my old teakettle and sweating with the stove’s heat. I love this kettle. The inside bottom is cool too. It’s a very clear mirror.
customer_reviews.author: onetwothree

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money, but lacks features
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * Price * Footprint * Boils very fast * Water level window, so you boil just enough Cons: * Needs 2-3 boils first, one with vinegar before using, otherwise water has metallic taste. * Lid isn't spring loaded, doesn't return to closed position on its own. * No "ready" buzzer.
customer_reviews.author: Marko DiPollo

customer_reviews.title: Smells of plastic
customer_reviews.text: The inner part of the lid is plastic, such that the boiled water reeked of plastic. However, Amazon helped out with a refund
customer_reviews.author: Augi

customer_reviews.title: Calcium Deposits! BUT HOT WATER!
customer_reviews.text: The product is good but the calcium deposits are annoying! The grooves at the bottom make it hard to clean in the cracks. The product does what it says, boils water very quickly! I love the fact of that, but if you're a clean freak like me, you'll hate the calcium leftovers. Make sure you use clean, filtered water for each boil. If you are lazy and use regular tap or fountain water, boil some vinegar here and there to remove the white build up at the bottom. At first I didn't notice it but when you see white flakes in the tank, you cringe in disgust a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Hiatus

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe: outside becomes steaming hot to the touch
customer_reviews.text: This works well but I’m giving it a 1 because the outside becomes searing hot when you hear water. Too bad. I got this instead of the Bodum brand. Will now order the latter which has an insulated pot. This isn’t 1975 for crying out loud, no reason this pot shouldn’t be insulated and SAFE
customer_reviews.author: IVRN

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't suggest buying this.
customer_reviews.text: Initially this worked great. Heats and boils water crazy fast for my tea every morning. Less than a month of using it I noticed shiny, flaky, metal material floating around in my water when I pour it into my mug. Upon closer look the bottom of the kettle (see image attached) had started flaking and falling apart, and those flakes end up in your water... kinda gross. I still use the kettle and pour the water through a strainer when I pour it into my mug. it was inexpensive, but still disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rorrus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: What a waste. My office mate and I wanted a kettle for our space but didn't want to spend a fortune. We made the mistake of trusting star ratings and Amazon's name. This product arrived in good time, but when I unwrapped it, the cord was not even long enough to allow it to be plugged into the wall and sit on the table right above it. We decided that we would just have to invest in an extension cord, and when we tested it, the kettle boiled one pot, and it has not worked since. Honestly, spend a little more and don't bother with this inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Pinkston

customer_reviews.title: Love this tea kettle!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We recently decided to invest in a french press for making coffee and needed a tea kettle to heat up the water. I have the old stovetop tea kettles, but I don't like those as much. After being overseas and seeing that everyone uses an electric kettle, I decided to purchase one too. This is very easy to use and I'm amazed at how quickly it heats up water. The water stays hot for quite a while too. My daughter loved it so much when she came to visit that we bought her one too!
customer_reviews.author: daffy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought it coz its easy to clean. but there is plastic parts inside especially the lid. not sure its BPA Free. coz you know that is where all the steam gets and there is a good chance of the plastic residues in the water as steam is hotter than the water. They failed to put steel in the right spot. you get what you pay for. I am keeping it though coz mine is a temporary use.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality, mine ended up literally coming apart, some of the interior white plastic started sloughing off into my hot water in 1 week!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe, but it works
customer_reviews.text: This water heater has no internal shut-off. The only way it shuts off automatically is if the switch has clearance to move upward. During normal operation this switch was caught under a protrusion of my toaster-oven, which prevented automatic shut off, and a liter of water nearly boiled away in a matter of minutes. I think selling this unit is incredibly negligent on Amazons part, but I'll still use it. I just keep it unplugged and stored in a box when it's not actively being used because I'm understandably anxious it's going to set my house on fire.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Detachable heating base is a game changer
customer_reviews.text: Another Amazon Basics slam-dunk. The detachable base is a game changer. I hosted a tea party for my local Salvation Army and bought 5. They all arrived in perfect condition and they looked sleek and sharp. I could heat them up in the kitchen in seconds and then detach from the base to place on the tables. The portability feature is #1. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Highly recommended. If this review was helpful please let me know by clicking the “Helpful” button below the review.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but. . .
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for just a few weeks. It heats up fast BUT, the inside bottom is already getting pitted. I drain it after use, but the inside bottom metal piece is showing signs of 'deterioration'. Don't expect it to be durable in the long run. I would return it but I threw out the box. I usually keep the packaging for a long time but I did not expect to have a problem. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: You wouldn't want to drink water boiled in this kettle!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it is loud af. But the worst part is that weird residue come from the bottom of the container every time after I boil water in it. I have boiled water for 6,7 times now and there is still a layer of stuff on the surface of the water. When I tried to rub the bottom of the kettle with my fingers, some white stuff sticks to my fingers. And the removable filter is difficult to remove! I don't dare drink that water, idk what is in it! This product simply fails at its purpose. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Watch your hands!
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed with this item. It heated the water very fast which was great but the entire kettle, minus the handle was so insanely hot! As long as you make sure you ONLY touch the handle and have no little ones near by that may accidentally touch the kettle you will be in good shape. I had to warn everyone that went to pick it up and some people still burnt their hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fair quality but it’s inexpensive and it works
customer_reviews.text: I’ll drink pour-over coffee made from the hot water this inexpensive hot water kettle produces ... it’s perfect for the office. I hope I don’t die from contaminated Chinese metal and plastic but it precludes my need to visit the gourmet coffee shop for a couple of coffees each day. Fit and finish are fair. The kettle wobbles a bit on the base (just like the one my wife’s coworker has so it’s inconsistent). As far as easy to clean, just fill with distilled white vinegar and boil it ... then use the vinegar to clean calcium from your water faucet aerators, shower heads, shower glass.
customer_reviews.author: R. Seifert

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but...
customer_reviews.text: Had this hot water kettle for around a week. Works great, heats fast, looks nice and it is a great price. Just one issue. I'm right handed and I pour with my right hand. The way the lid opens, when you pour with your right hand, you can't see the window that lets you see how full the pot is. Pretty sure my last pot had a window on both sides, or maybe the window was simple enough to see by looking inside while pouring. But, the Amazon Basic window has a bulky frame and you can't see it well through the lid opening (which doesn't open too far). If you can live with that, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: NetMorin

customer_reviews.title: Heats quick but quick working.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first but already crapped out. Probably only used it 30 times. Not very happy with this purchase. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Fast fast fast
customer_reviews.text: Gets hot faster than my old one did, but it holds less too. The outside gets hot as well which I learned today 😅 I’m all about the speed to make one drink though so it’s a winner for that!
customer_reviews.author: Mom3boys

customer_reviews.title: Boiling water sprayed everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: After my old kettle died I figured this was a good way to go. I’ve never been one to overfill the pot and yet this little beast shot blazing hot water, geyser-style up the fronts of my cabinets on several occasions. Amazon was kind enough to refund my money even though it was past window of returns. Ended up buying an Aroma brand kettle which I’m very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Great value, but cord is too short
customer_reviews.text: After several weeks of testing I am giving this electric kettle 4 stars. This works well for two of us but for a larger family I would recommend a larger size. Heats water fast, like 3.5 minutes fast. I bought it after using one at a vacation rental. Much safer than boiling water on a stove as it will automatically shut off once the water hits the boiling point. The only reason I gave it less than 5 stars is because of the short electric cord that limited where on my counter top I could put it.
customer_reviews.author: CorradoWest

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly, awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! To think, I've been heating water for tea in the stove like some sort of peasant! This heats the water MUCH faster, automatically turns off when it's done, and has the run dry safety feature (haven't accidentally tested that out yet though). Making tea makes me anxious because I'm always worried I'm going to forget the stove... this eliminates that worry. The only improvement would be a beep or something when it's done... the light does switch off, but if you're not looking directly at it, or got distracted, your water could be cooling down before you remember. but for the price, really can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years still working like new
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best buy I've made. Bought in Jan 2018 and have abused it 3-4 times a day and more since covid quarantine. Among all the brand name higher priced electric kettles I have gone through, this has survived the longest. Although this review will be posted after Prime Day 2020 ($17.59), I thought I'd give it a nod.
customer_reviews.author: H.T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to love electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: This kettle hits the sweet spot in the categories of value, size, functionality and appearance. It holds 1 liter, which is a little less than a quart. Its the perfect size for heating water quickly for one to three cups of tea. The on/off button lights up when on. The auto shut off is an important safety feature. The lid opens up to about 3/4 to fully open. I would like it to open fully, but this has not been an issue for either filling or cleaning. Love this kettle and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: Cute little kettle of good quality steel
customer_reviews.text: Cute little kettle of good quality steel. Warms water pretty quickly. Cons: It warms up the surface as well, not double walled, can be a hazard if within reach of a kid. It makes loud noise while boiling water but only stays for a minute or so, so not that big of a problem for me. Overall nice, cheap steel kettle that works!
customer_reviews.author: CosmosK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for price
customer_reviews.text: At first when h bought this product I thought I was going to be some cheapo thing but honestly it has been amazing . It is super easy to learn how to work and teach how to work . It gets hot water really fast and gets the job done . Kinda weird to clean but you get the hang of it . The only complaint I have is that it’s load when it is heating but I use it in my office so it’s okay but for people that are using then at home in the morning and don’t want to wake others up , it’s pretty noisy. I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: yesenia fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Tea lovers dream
customer_reviews.text: I dont know why I waited so long to buy one. I've use to heat water in the microwave. I'll never go back. This is a life changer for tea lovers. Heats up super fast
customer_reviews.author: kaykayNtyty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect considering what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought an electric water kettle and it does the job: heat the water! It is quick, and super easy to use (like any other electric kettle I have ever seen). However, the low price shows a little in a few details: first, the outside of the kettle gets hot, so you have to make sure to use the handle without touching the metal (but it doesn't get too hot; like, it hurts a bit but no burns or anything). Then, the lid doesn't open completely, which makes filling it a little annoying sometimes. But these two "problems" are really nothing, just minor inconveniences considering the low price of the kettle. I don't regret the buy one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boils over
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is visually appealing, but the outside gets VERY hot when contents are heated. I've let it reach boiling point twice now and with only .75 l water, boiling hot water comes shooting out the spout, burning and soaking everything nearby. THEN it switches off. Water does get hot, so one star. The other star for being cordless. Not very safe and kind of scary otherwise...
customer_reviews.author: Gewaltraud

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: It's a electric Kettle - works as it should and brings water to boiling pretty rapidly (about 4-5 minutes for a full container). It has an auto shut-off once boiling temperature is achieved - and the water stays hot/warm inside for a good amount of time after. This is convenient if you heat water up, then need to tend to something else; you can come back, turn it back on and the water is back to boiling in even less time. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Rim has rusted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle in Nov 2018 to use in my office. It is now March 2019 and the rim (see photo) has already rusted! It is a very strange place to rust because that has the least amount of contact with water. I am not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Electric piece is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Second time I have bought this. Electric part went out after about 10 uses on first and this one burnt out on second use.
customer_reviews.author: shaun d tolbert

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple and so far very reliable hot water kettle. It doesn't have any bells or whistles like many others but it performs its task very well. I only need about a half liter for my tea and that amount is boiling in about 2 minutes, much faster than what I was using before because I had to heat up much more water than I needed. And it delivers boiling hot water exactly what is needed to brew loose leaf tea. Remember it is an Amazon BASICS product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nony Mause

customer_reviews.title: So far it's great!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a few weeks and it works great. It holds enough water for my hubby and I to both have a cup. It heats up in just a few minutes (maybe 3) and I love the automatic shut off! It is a bit loud when it's working, but that's how I realize when it's done heating up my water. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Leon R.

customer_reviews.title: Dandy Little Pot!
customer_reviews.text: I got this little gem to replace an old plastic one that had a short thick cord that had to be unplugged every time I Wanted to empty or fill it. It still worked, it was just too annoying to deal with several times a day. This one looks nice with it's sleek stainless steel design and is super easy to clean, fill and empty since the heating element is separate and stays in place on the counter. The cord stays neatly wrapped up and out of the way. All around a nifty kitchen addition.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen RoseTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Keeps up with heavy use, so far
customer_reviews.text: My favorite and most used kitchen appliance. Heats quickly, has an auto shutoff once it reaches temp, and doesn't take up my entire countertop. I really like that I can take the pot off its base andaround the kitchen without having to drag a cord with me or needing a hot glove. I daily heat multiple pots of water for pourover or frech press coffee, miso soup, oatmeal, rice noodles, tea, starting a pot for boiling, hot cleaning water, etc, etc, etc. It has worked like a champ so far. My last electric kettle (built in the 1980, bought from the thriftshop in 2010) lasted for 8+ years, yes it still works, so hopefully this will last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Donat

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: After years of using pot(s) that had a thermostatic heat control, we tried this little feller. It holds a liter (quart) but implies it should be run between 1/4 and 3/4 full by the size of the sight glass. That's about the way I run my cars gas tank so I was ok with it. I can't see a problem with filling nearly to the top and I have a separate switch at the outlet so I can shut it off (could unplug it also) if I want to empty it. I suspect it would turn off quickly if it was started empty but choose not to experiment. This takes a bit of fiddling but will stay off if unattended.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Meddaugh

customer_reviews.title: Can I give it 4.5 stars?
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a path to reduce my carbon footprint, and reduce the amount of plastic in my life. I get that electric kettles are more efficient than the tea kettle on the stove. But I was pleasantly surprised to find almost no plastic in the packing material. Just a plastic sleeve to protect the finish. That could probably be replaced with paper. The rest was pure cardboard. Thank you. Oh- why did I not give it 5 stars? It is obviously a right-handed tool. Fortunately I'm right handed. If you move the sight glass to the handle, and get rid of the plastic sleeve, this would rate 5 very shiny stars.
customer_reviews.author: William Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Received the kettle and it looks great. Cleaned it then used it and it worked awesome once. The second time I used it, it leaked a bit of water from the base and I just thought I had spilled it. I just wiped it off and thought nothing of it. The third time I used it there was more water than I felt comfortable with to use it again as it was leaking around the electrical connection. I would not recommend this kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Billy W. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: My stainless steel kettle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in March 2019. It is a good product. No sediments on the inside like other products. It is sediment free. But around March 2020 I noticed some rusting in the crease where the side panel meets the bottom panel. It's only in one area. I bought 2 of them. One for my daughter and myself. My daughter's own is in perfect condition just mine with the rust. I did not expect this stainless steel to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Hosanna M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but smells
customer_reviews.text: This kettle works fast, is nice and small but had a plastic piece inside that smells. Too late to return. i'm worried about BPA and the plastic getting so hot. The inside has a plastic odor and i've used it alot
customer_reviews.author: RICH PARKEN

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle a year ago, after my mom needed to move in with me. Between the two of us, we use the kettle at least 6+ times a day. It has been reliable and fast every time. Only once did I notice that the lever didn't "click up" and turn off the kettle. The only problem we've had is from calcium or water deposits. The deposits are now starting to cover up the water level window, making it difficult to figure out how much water is in the pot. Since my mom needs to be able to clearly see what she is doing, I will probably order another pot, and save this one in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Anomalee

customer_reviews.title: Efficient!
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget boils water so quick. I’ve been brewing cups of hot tea as a new hobby and this makes it great. I drink a lot of iced tea also and it helps me make it so much faster. There is some plastic that the hot water comes in contact with. It’s perturbing but it’s not much at all. Overall it’s a great but. Also, my first pot either got delivered to the wrong house or someone swiped my box. I’ve ordered tons of Amazon products and this never happened. Amazon swiftly took care of the problem. I’m amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon King

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint
customer_reviews.text: I only make one (large) cup at a time so I didn't need a large capacity kettle. This does not take up much counterspace. Heats faster than a stove top kettle. Not particularly noisy, no metallic taste, hot exterior hasn't been a problem. The only quibble I have is when it clicks off after boiling, the sound is not very loud if you are in another room (that's why I get automatic off kettles, so I don't have to hang around waiting for them to boil). I've only had it for a week. We'll see if it lasts longer than my previous cheapo one (different brand) which stopped working after a total of 12 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Honey West

customer_reviews.title: LOVE This!!
customer_reviews.text: In reality, these hot pots last forever! I had one that I had for years, so long in fact that the white plastic was really discolored. My daughter kept telling me to "throw that ugly thing away Mom!" Well, I couldn't because it still worked. When I packed for my move, my daughter tossed it out so I had to buy a new one. I'm so glad she did that because now I got a nice shiny new hot pot and it goes nicely in my nice new kitchen!! I don't think this one can discolor due to the fact that its silver so I think it's safe for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Extremely dangerous
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. The water gets too hot and boils over. Burnt my skin to 2nd degree burns when I spilled it.
customer_reviews.author: kamesh yadavalli

customer_reviews.title: Great for super fast hot water
customer_reviews.text: Using this kettle is so much faster than stove top. I can get hot water in about 3-5 minutes, and the kettle holds enough water to make 2 regular size travel mugs of tea. I use it all the time and make more tea than I ever had before. For people with rust issues, make sure to pop open the top after using the hot water otherwise a lot of condensation can build on the inside due to the small spout being the only other air escape. The condensation can sit around for days, which can easily cause rust on any "stainless" metal cut edges.
customer_reviews.author: BurstingVeins

customer_reviews.title: Worked About 1yr Before Leaking
customer_reviews.text: It worked just fine while it worked. Perfectly as expected, and it looks classy too. However, after just under a year of daily use (making coffee every morning), it started leaking from the bottom this morning. :( I'll probably try to look elsewhere for a better quality replacement, perhaps one with less plastic on/in it too. I'd rather have something that will last several years since I know we will use it for that long.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: 100% WONDERFUL KETTLE
customer_reviews.text: My old tea kettle was difficult to fill...dangerous to pour as the handle was as hot as the water...SO>> welcome to 2020 this stainless steel electric pot is fabulous. No cord..as the heating unit is separate. The lid opens with a lever at the handle. It automatically shuts off when boiling. AND it's only 1 Litre...instead of 1.7. Double walled stainless steel so no heat at your hands..just perfect...for the lowest price.. Happy as can be with this new pot..no more worries about burning myself on my cuppa..
customer_reviews.author: PA  Porchsitter

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product, get in to details for more information
customer_reviews.text: Great Product for sure. - Bought 1Litre Kettle Pro: Quick heat, durability will be good, nice and cute design. Cons: 1. Difficult to clean the kettle since the space doesnt fit for Men and Women hands to put in, expecting small palm will be suffice for cleaning. 2. Should be careful for any one in the family not to touch the outer body directly after heat, it might cause burnes. More need to investigate on formation of Rest inside after using for few more months. Happy Shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Harish

customer_reviews.title: Good product, as long as you are careful
customer_reviews.text: This is a good small electric kettle, perfect for a single person or a couple. If you have children or elderly people at home, however, BUY SOMETHING SAFER. The exterior of the kettle gets very hot: if you forget to touch only the handle, you will burn your hands. And if you don't empty it after boiling water, the kettle can stay as hot as an iron for over ten minutes. For the same reason, I always put it on an uncluttered surface, away from anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo F.

customer_reviews.title: A reasonable investment for a favorite appliance
customer_reviews.text: We use an electric kettle like this a lot, and I mean a lot, being avid tea drinkers. The problem is that they burn out or the switches go south too fast. We've tried several brands and only one from Germany lasted more than 12-18 months. So, when the latest one went wobbly, we got this one. A little smaller than others, it takes up less space on the counter, which is nice. It's very attractive, and we will see how long it lasts. But --- even if it goes after the warranty expires, the price for replacement is not prohibitive.
customer_reviews.author: compostfan

customer_reviews.title: After just a few months, the button to open the lid has stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This was a decent little tea kettle at first blush. It doesn't take up very much counter space, it heats the water fairly quickly, it has a decent capacity... But it was brought to my attention after I bought it that it has a fair amount of plastic exposed to the steaming water, which is really unhealthy. Most disappointing, the button on the handle that pops open the lid has stopped working properly, just a few months after having bought it. I guess you get what you pay for. I'm pretty sure this thing was less than 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Rust Prone
customer_reviews.text: It is great product to heat up water quick and keeps it warm. Very handy for hot tea. Just in 5 months of use, noticed rust inside at bottom. Did not expected a stainless steel item to rust. Talked to Amazon and they were prompt to send a replacement as it was still under warranty. Only they wanted the previous item back - which I almost threw
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Great electric kettle!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Heats up super fast and keeps water hot for a long time even after it shuts off. The auto shut off is a nice feature, so there's no worry about it boiling over or boiling dry. The only downside is that the kettle gets very hot, so you need to be careful not to touch it while it's going or well after, but the same can be said about a stovetop kettle.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Dependable Hot Water Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Heats several cups (1.7L) of water very quickly. Automatic shut-off when water is ready and will Never boil dry. Easy to keep clean and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: CHAMELEON

customer_reviews.title: I can not recommend, too small and pot can burn you if touched after boiling
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned this pot. I made the mistake of choosing this pot which barely holds enough water for to good size cups. My biggest disappointment is that the pot is as hot on the outside as the liquid is on the inside. If not careful, you can burn yourself touching the pot after the liquid has boiled. The manufacturer should have ‘jacketed’ the pot to insulate the outside of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rashid

customer_reviews.title: So loud
customer_reviews.text: This is so loud. Bought it for work but when it’s heating the water I literally have to shout over it to be heard by someone 3 ft away.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Bell

customer_reviews.title: This little kettle is great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this little guy for 9 months and I love it. I bought it to replace a $200.00 kettle which broke after 6 mo. In frustration I purchased this inexpensive, basic kettle. Here's what i really like: 1. It is safe. Even when full I don't need to use two hands to pour a cup and it has automatic shut off. 2. It works. Every time i need a cup of tea, it fires right up and quickly heats water. 3. Efficiency. I don't waste time / energy heating too much water. I never make a pot of tea, just cups. 4. It is small. It takes up no space on my kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: lkgato

customer_reviews.title: if it only lasted
customer_reviews.text: its cheap as in inexpensive, a nice thing. It heats the water quickly, another good thing. Its safe, one more good thing. But, and boy does this thing have a big but, it didnt last more than half a year. Plus it was starting to rust, ummmm says its stainless steal, but its very very very, cheap stainless steal. If you dont mind getting a new one every 6 months to a year be my guest buy this hunk of crap. Sad to say, just about all the Amazon brands are crap.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using this daily to boil water for Korean instant coffee packets. This kettle boils water in less than a minute flat!
customer_reviews.author: Two-Line Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Takes the pressure off boiling water
customer_reviews.text: My wife, using the old tea kettle, routinely let water boil and overflow into the range while she left the room. After reluctantly trying this product she has never used the old kettle again. Our stove top and myself are eternally grateful. This electric kettle boils at max level (1.7 L) in about 7 minutes and then turns off automatically. For some reason it's hotter than the range-top kettle water, which means it is really hot. Nice design that blends into typical kitchen decor.
customer_reviews.author: propercharlie

customer_reviews.title: Quite Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 years ago and still works great. Heats super fast. I prefer the 1L as it is smaller. Perfect for tiny dwellings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Does exact what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my roommate as a gift because she would frequently boil water in a small pot (and then forget about it). I bought this in an effort to avoid burning the house down. She LOVES it and has been using it 2-3 times a day ever since. I'm very impressed by the quality and ease of use and could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ahvienda Kotura

customer_reviews.title: Pot is fast, safe but a little loud.
customer_reviews.text: This little pot does it fast! It’s a little loud but that just means it’s not going to take long! I like that the cord is separate from the pot for ease in handling and that it shuts off after boiling! Plus the lid is spring hinged so you don’t have to hold it opened to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Colquitt

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this item. Price is great compared to others. No safty features so keep out of reach from children. Hard to clean because it has a small opening and the lid does not come of ...which is a plus for me. But really all you should have in it is plain water. So jus empty afer every use and rinse. Only two temperature settings On/Off so you start with cold and then get boiling. I hope it lasts. I like it and its fairly quick.
customer_reviews.author: Like to Buy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and works perfectly. No complaints whatsoever. Great unit. <edit 7/12/19>The other feature that I forgot to mention and that I LOVE is the push button to open the top of the unit to fill. For someone w/arthritis in their hands, this is a godsend. I don't remember when I purchased this. I still think it is a great unit for the price. Seems perhaps to be taking a bit longer to boil but certainly not a big deal. Good job, Amazon. :)
customer_reviews.author: Diane M

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Hot, Safe
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a way to make a fast cup of tea in my bedroom. Pour in 12 oz. of purified water from my Pur pitcher. Two minutes later, my tea bag is brewing in water just off boiling. It has good safety features, including auto off. The small attached lid makes scrubbing the inside essentially impossible. I use filtered water to reduce mineral buildup, so I will clean it simply by filling it to the maximum level and boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: alanhouston

customer_reviews.title: Heats up water fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kettle if you are looking for something to heat up and boil water quickly. It will heat up 2 Liters of water in about 2 minutes at most. It is very effective, especially when I am in a hurry to get a hot drink ready or to get water boiling for pasta etc. I highly recommend it if you are just looking to use it for water. However, it can ONLY be used for water. If you want to use a kettle for milk or other liquids you shouldn't get this because the liquid will just burn to the bottom of the kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Broke fast
customer_reviews.text: I have had the water boiler for 3-4 weeks. The lid broke, and it is no longer possible to take it off. Terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Celine Stray

customer_reviews.title: A Great Travel Kettle
customer_reviews.text: This kettle comes in 2 sizes; I selected the smaller of the 2 which was 1.5 liters. As a tea drinker, this allowed me to enjoy tea in my hotel room after a long, cold day. The kettle is quick to boil and has ample capacity, more than needed to pour and fill a 16 oz mug. I saw one comment about this kettle rusting, however, I just dry it completely after use... anyway, how can anyone have complaints about a kettle for $15?
customer_reviews.author: P. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and great safety features
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. I bought it for my French press. I didn’t bother reading the instructions but was pleasantly surprised that the unit automatically shuts off when it hits boiling point, a safety feature I’m happy to have. The unit heats up literally within a couple minutes. Incredibly convenient. I also like that the lid needs to be pressed to be shut so that you do not inadvertently spill boiling water out of the top. The side level is also convenient. To me it’s no big deal that it’s plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Glennoel Dye

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's intended for... boiling water. The charging base seems kind of cheap and the cord is pretty stiff. It whistles really loudly when ready, but it does turn off automatically which is handy. Nothing fancy, but functional.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and boils water fast! Auto shut off.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Heats 1 liter of water in a little over 4 minutes and 1/2 a liter in just over 2 minutes. I purchased this item for my mom who is a senior citizen who lives on her own. When I visit I sometimes noticed that she forgot she was boiling water to make tea. This item automatically turns off when the water has boiled so I no longer have to worry about her doing that when I am not around. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This steel electric kettle is smaller than what I expected. For the first time I used it, I can smell strong steel taste and I think because it’s new, maybe I use for few time this taste will go away; but after I used it for one week and the steel taste still stay. Finally, I am so disappointed for this product。
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good product at good price
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it, I microwave my water but she doesn't like lol . So I got this for her and she loves it. I was surprised at how quick it boils water for tea and coffee. I definitely recommend or purchase it as a gift for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Really sleek, perfect for smaller kitchen counters
customer_reviews.text: I loveeee tea and coffee. I bought this because my previous kettle had broke. This kettle is perfect. It looks really sleek and has kept up the appearance - I haven't noticed any scratches, discoloration, or anything. It boils water super fast and keeps it warm for a long while after. This kettle is only 1L, so it's small enough to fit on crowded kitchen countertops, yet big enough to pour a few cups of coffee or tea from. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant buy, recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was just Amazon plugging their own stuff but I needed a kettle and did a review and this was in the top 3 of independent reviews so I went for it. It’s a brilliant kettle. Heats up super fast and is much better than the one I had that was 3 times the price. It’s a neat size as well (see pic), but still holds a liter (versus the larger 1.7 ltr kettles but it’s perfect for what I need. At max capacity you get 4 good size cups from it. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M
